actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on September 15, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Kiley (CA) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House resumed with Special Order speeches.

Select Subcommittee to Investigate the Remaining Questions Surrounding January 6, 2021- Pursuant to House Resolution 605 and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Select Subcommittee to Investigate the Remaining Questions Surrounding January 6, 2021: Mr. Loudermilk (Chair), Mr. Griffith, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Nehls, Ms. Hageman, Mr. Swalwell, Ms. Crockett and Mr. Moskowitz.

The Speaker appointed conferees: Cole, Aderholt, Carter of Texas, Harris of Maryland, Valadao, Newhouse, Moolenaar, Rutherford, Cline, Hinson, Letlow, Guest, Zinke, Bice, Scott Franklin of Florida, LaLota, Strong, Maloy, Moore of West Virginia, DeLauro, Hoyer, Kaptur, Bishop, Wasserman Schultz, Cuellar, Pingree, Quigley, Espaillat, Underwood, Levin, Escobar, and Perez.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House resumed with one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 93, S. 306, S. 725, and S. 759.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Westerman asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Thursday, September 11, 2025, it adjourn to meet on Monday, September 15, 2025 at noon for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 226

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3486 — "To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase penalties for individuals who illegally enter and reenter the United States after being removed, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House instruct conferees Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 211

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motion to instruct conferees on H.R. 3944 and passage of H.R. 3486.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 3486, the Chair put the question on passage of the bill and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Raskin demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 3486.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3838 and H.R. 3486. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 3838 under a structured rule and H.R. 3486 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 682. H.R. 3486 — "To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase penalties for individuals who illegally enter and reenter the United States after being removed, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Shreve to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
